title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 810.9 - Project evaluation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 810.9 - Project evaluation

State Regulations

The department shall conduct audits of training and
education projects funded under this Part. These audits may include site visits
as well as monitoring of programmatic and fiscal responsibility, and review of
periodic progress reports, vouchers and other financial statements. Within 90
days of the conclusion of each project funded under this Part, the grantee
shall submit a written summary and evaluation of the project to the board, in a
format prescribed by the department, and shall include any information deemed
by the department and the board to be relevant to measuring the success of the
project. The criteria to be applied in evaluating projects funded under this

Part may include: (a) The number of
persons reached through the program. (b) The extent to which the project carried
out its stated objectives. (c) The
impact of the project. (d) The
extent to which the program was completed within its projected
budget. (e) The grantee's
compliance with reporting and other requirements of the programs. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
810.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
